greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors of 10^n + 1 (counted with multiplicity).
comment: 2^(a(2n)-1)-1 predicts the number of pair-solutions of even length L for AB = A^2 + B^2. For instance, with length 18 we have 10^18 + 1 = 101*9901*999999000001 or 3 divisors F which when put into the Mersenne formula 2^(F-1)-1 yields 3 pairs (see reference 'Puzzle 104' for details).
link: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..310 (from Kamada link)
Carlos Rivera, Puzzle 104, The Prime Puzzles & Problems Connection.
S. S. Wagstaff, Jr., Main Tables from the Cunningham Project.
S. S. Wagstaff, Jr., The Cunningham Project
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, Oct 15 2000
